install.body:
Installing '__module__'

Before installing, please read the node's documentation. Some nodes have dependencies that cannot be automatically resolved and can require a restart of Node-RED.
install.title: Install nodes

remove.body:
Removing '__module__'

Removing the node will uninstall it from Node-RED. The node may continue to use resources until Node-RED is restarted.
remove.title: Remove nodes

update.body:
Updating '__module__'

Updating the node will require a restart of Node-RED to complete the update. This must be done manually.
update.title: Update nodes

expressionEditor.title: JSONata Expression editor
expressionEditor.compatModeDesc:
JSONata compatibility mode

The current expression appears to still reference msg so will be evaluated in compatibility mode. Please update the expression to not use msg as this mode will be removed in the future.

When JSONata support was first added to Node-RED, it required the expression to reference the msg object. For example msg.payload would be used to access the payload.

That is no longer necessary as the expression will be evaluated against the message directly. To access the payload, the expression should be just payload.

bufferEditor.title: Buffer editor
bufferEditor.modeDesc:
Buffer editor

The Buffer type is stored as a JSON array of byte values. The editor will attempt to parse the entered value as a JSON array. If it is not valid JSON, it will be treated as a UTF-8 String and converted to an array of the individual character code points.

For example, a value of Hello World will be converted to the JSON array:

[72, 101, 108, 108, 111, 32, 87, 111, 114, 108, 100]

welcome.hello: Hello! We have introduced 'projects' to Node-RED.
welcome.desc0: This is a new way for you to manage your flow files and includes version control of your flows.
welcome.desc1: To get started you can create your first project or clone an existing project from a git repository.
welcome.desc2: If you are not sure, you can skip this for now. You will still be able to create your first project from the 'Projects' menu at any time.

git-config.desc0: Node-RED uses the open source tool Git for version control. It tracks changes to your project files and lets you push them to remote repositories.
git-config.desc1: When you commit a set of changes, Git records who made the changes with a username and email address. The Username can be anything you want - it does not need to be your real name.
git-config.desc2: Your Git client is already configured with the details below.
git-config.desc3: You can change these settings later under the 'Git config' tab of the settings dialog.

project-details.desc0: A project is maintained as a Git repository. It makes it much easier to share your flows with others and to collaborate on them.
project-details.desc1: You can create multiple projects and quickly switch between them from the editor.
project-details.desc2: To begin, your project needs a name and an optional description.

clone-project.desc0: If you already have a git repository containing a project, you can clone it to get started.
clone-project.no-info-in-url: Do not include the username/password in the url
clone-project.ssh-key-desc: Before you can clone a repository over ssh you must add an SSH key to access it.
clone-project.cant-get-ssh-key: Error! Can't get selected SSH key path.

default-files.desc0: A project contains your flow files, a README file and a package.json file.
default-files.desc1: It can contain any other files you want to maintain in the Git repository.
default-files.desc2: Your existing flow and credential files will be copied into the project.

encryption-config.setup: Setup encryption of your credentials file
encryption-config.desc0: Your flow credentials file can be encrypted to keep its contents secure.
encryption-config.desc1: If you want to store these credentials in a public Git repository, you must encrypt them by providing a secret key phrase.
encryption-config.desc2: Your flow credentials file is not currently encrypted.
encryption-config.desc3: That means its contents, such as passwords and access tokens, can be read by anyone with access to the file.
encryption-config.desc4: If you want to store these credentials in a public Git repository, you must encrypt them by providing a secret key phrase.
encryption-config.desc5: Your flow credentials file is currently encrypted using the credentialSecret property from your settings file as the key.
encryption-config.desc6: Your flow credentials file is currently encrypted using a system-generated key. You should provide a new secret key for this project.
encryption-config.desc7: The key will be stored separately from your project files. You will need to provide the key to use this project in another instance of Node-RED.
encryption-config.desc8: The credentials file will not be encrypted and its contents easily read

create-success.success: You have successfully created your first project!
create-success.desc0: You can now continue to use Node-RED just as you always have.
create-success.desc1: The 'info' tab in the sidebar shows you what your current active project is. The button next to the name can be used to access the project settings view.
create-success.desc2: The 'history' tab in the sidebar can be used to view files that have changed in your project and to commit them. It shows you a complete history of your commits and allows you to push your changes to a remote repository.

create.no-info-in-url: Do not include the username/password in the url
create.desc0: A phrase to secure your credentials with
create.desc1: The credentials file will not be encrypted and its contents easily read
create.desc2: Before you can clone a repository over ssh you must add an SSH key to access it.
create.cant-get-ssh-key-path: Error! Can't get selected SSH key path.
